column4: hey guys, i just installed karmic my wireless is working great on gnome, but i just installed e17, wireless doesn't seem to work any ideas ?
e17 doesn't start network manager applet would be my guess, so you don't get a connection.
k lemme try starting it
ermm how i start the network manager applet manualy ?
I just hinted at the answer: not worth finding out. Just use GNOME :)
i wanna use e17,
but if you are adventurous, try "nm-applet" from command line. It either starts or fails.
or maybe it's called network-manager-applet or Network-Manager-applet. I'm not quite sure what they call that little thing.
nm-applet it is
well i guess its running, but since i can't see it anywhere hehehe
if it starts, then good. You can probably force it to start somehow at beginning of session. If it doesn't work, you're probably out of luck with respect to that.
and I state again: don't use e17. It's stupid.
Not supported. Nonsense. Just wastes time.
hmm
ok, can ya help me on a related topic ?/
if i don't wanna use nm=applet for using my wireless on gnome, what are the alternatives ?
By the way, is e17 the enlightenment version they've been working on for at least 5 years? Or is it more now?
i tried wicd on gnome, it detected by wireless, but never connected, it authenticated etc. but always got stuck on the getting ip address part
hehe no idea
wicd, or somehow configure nm-applet to start the connection even when the applet isn't running. It's possible somehow, but I don't know the tools too well
i tried wicd on gnome, it detected by wireless, but never connected, it authenticated etc. but always got stuck on the getting ip address part
well, tells all about how well linux stuff works. There's generally only one thing that works (which is what everyone else is doing). Step outside that, and you're mostly on your own.
